description.para: Function pointer prototypes, forward declaration using "struct xbee_dev_t" instead of "xbee_dev_t" since we use the types in the xbee_dev_t definition.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* xbee_frame_handler_fn) (struct xbee_dev_t *xbee, const void FAR *frame, uint16_t length, void FAR *context)
memberdef.argsstring: )(struct xbee_dev_t *xbee, const void FAR *frame, uint16_t length, void FAR *context)
memberdef.name: xbee_frame_handler_fn

briefdescription.para: Standard API for an XBee frame handler in xbee_frame_handlers global.

detaileddescription.para: These functions are only called when xbee_dev_tick() or wpan_tick() are called and a complete frame is ready for processing.

simplesect.para: There isn't an actual xbee_frame_handler_fn function in the XBee libraries. This documentation exists as a template for writing frame handlers.

parameterdescription.para: XBee device that received frame.
Pointer to frame data. Data starts with the frame type (the 0x7E start byte and frame length are stripped by lower layers of the driver).
Number of bytes in frame.
Handler-specific "context" value, chosen when the handler was registered with xbee_frame_handler_add.
successfully processed frame
error processing frame

briefdescription.para: Function to check the XBee device's AWAKE pin to see if it is awake.

XBee module is awake.
XBee module is asleep.

briefdescription.para: Function to process parsed Node ID messages.

detaileddescription.para: Programs can register a Node ID message handler with this signature to receive Node ID messages (either from ATND responses, Join Notifications, or as a result of Commissioning Button presses).

parsed Node ID message or NULL if a targeted discovery timed out

briefdescription.para: Possible values for the frame_type field of frames sent to and from the XBee module.

detaileddescription.para: Values with the upper bit set (0x80) are frames we receive from the XBee module. Values with the upper bit clear are for frames we send to the XBee.

memberdef.argsstring: (xbee_dev_t *xbee, const xbee_serial_t *serport, xbee_is_awake_fn is_awake, xbee_reset_fn reset)
memberdef.name: xbee_dev_init

briefdescription.para: Initialize the XBee device structure and open a serial connection to a local, serially-attached XBee module.

detaileddescription.para: This function does not actually initiate communications with the XBee module. See xbee_cmd_init_device() for information on initializing the "AT Command" layer of the driver, which will read basic information from the XBee module.

parameterdescription.para: XBee device to initialize.
Pointer to an xbee_serial_t structure used to initialize xbee->serport.
Pointer to function that reads the XBee module's "ON" pin. The function should return 1 if XBee is on and 0 if it is off.
Pointer to function that asserts the XBee module's "/RESET" pin. If asserted is TRUE, puts the XBee into reset. If asserted is FALSE, takes it out of reset. No return value.
Success
Invalid parameter (xbee is NULL, serport is not valid, etc.)
Couldn't set serial port baudrate within 5% of serport->baudrate.

briefdescription.para: Control whether xbee_frame_write() checks the XBee CTS signal before sending frames.

detaileddescription.para: Flow control is enabled in xbee_dev_init() by default.

parameterdescription.para: XBee to configure
TRUE to enable checking CTS before sending

briefdescription.para: Print information to stdout about the XBee device.

detaileddescription.para: Default behavior is to print the name of the serial port, the XBee module's hardware version (ATHV), firmware version (ATVR), IEEE address (ATSH/ATSL) and network address (ATMY).
Assumes the user has already called xbee_cmd_init_device() and waited for xbee_cmd_query_status() to finish.

briefdescription.para: Toggles the reset line of the XBee device.

parameterdescription.para: XBee device to reset.
Successfully toggled reset.
Invalid xbee_dev_t passed to function.
This XBee device doesn't have an interface to the module's reset pin.

briefdescription.para: Check for newly received frames on an XBee device and dispatch them to registered frame handlers.

detaileddescription.para: A program with an XBee interface needs to call this function often enough to keep up with inbound bytes.
Execution time depends greatly on how long each frame handler takes to process its frame.

simplesect.para: This function is NOT re-entrant and will return -EBUSY if it is called when already running.

parameterdescription.para: XBee device to check for, and then dispatch, new frames.
Number of frames received and dispatched.
If xbee isn't a valid device structure.
If xbee_dev_tick() was called when it's already running for this device.

internal.para: Dump the contents of the frame dispatch table for XBee device xbee. Must have XBEE_DEVICE_VERBOSE defined.

parameterdescription.para: XBee device of table to dump.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void FAR *bytes, uint16_t length, uint_fast8_t initial)
memberdef.name: _xbee_checksum

briefdescription.para: Calculate the checksum for an XBee frame.

internal.para: This function actually subtracts bytes from 0xFF, in order to determine the proper checksum byte so all bytes added together result in 0x00.
Frame checksums start with the frame type (first byte after frame length).
If calculating a checksum for an outgoing packet, sum all of the bytes using this function, and send the low byte of the result.
If verifying a received packet, summing all of the bytes after the length, including the packet's checksum byte, should result in 0x00.
Should only be used internally by this library.

parameterdescription.para: Buffer of bytes to add to sum, assumed non-NULL.
Number of bytes to add.
Starting checksum value. Use 0xFF to start or the result of the previous call if summing multiple blocks of data.

simplesect.para: Value from 0x00 to 0xFF that, when added to all bytes previously checksummed, results in a low byte of 0x00.

memberdef.argsstring: (xbee_dev_t *xbee, const void FAR *header, uint16_t headerlen, const void FAR *data, uint16_t datalen, uint16_t flags)
memberdef.name: xbee_frame_write

briefdescription.para: Copies a frame into the transmit serial buffer to send to an XBee module.

detaileddescription.para: Header should include bytes as they will be sent to the XBee. Function accepts separate header and data to limit the amount of copying necessary to send requests.
This function should only be called after xbee has been initialized by calling xbee_dev_init().

By default, xbee_frame_write() checks the /CTS signal from the XBee before attempting to send, and will return -EBUSY if the XBee has deasserted CTS. Use xbee_dev_flowcontrol() to disable this check (necessary on a system without a connection to the XBee module's /CTS signal).

parameterdescription.para: XBee device to send to.

Pointer to the header to send. Header starts with the frame type (this function will pre-pend the 0x7E start-of-frame and 16-bit length). Pass NULL if there isn't a header and the entire frame is in the payload (data and datalen).
Number of header bytes to send (starting with address passed in header). Ignored if header is NULL.
Address of frame payload or NULL if the entire frame content is stored in the header bytes (header and headerlen).
Number of payload bytes to send (starting with address passed in data). Ignored if data is NULL.

Optional flags
XBEE_WRITE_FLAG_NONE
Successfully queued frame in transmit serial buffer.
xbee is NULL or invalid flags passed
No data to send (headerlen + datalen == 0).
Transmit serial buffer is full, or XBee is not accepting serial data (deasserting /CTS signal).
Serial buffer can't ever send a frame this large.

briefdescription.para: Check XBee's serial buffer for complete frames and pass them off to the dispatcher.

internal.para: Should only be called after xbee has been initialized by calling xbee_dev_init(). Typically called by xbee_dev_tick().

parameterdescription.para: XBee device to read from.
No new frames waiting.
Number of frames processed.
Error.

briefdescription.para: Receive modem status frames and update flags/state of wpan_dev_t.
Function called by _xbee_frame_load() to dispatch any frames read.

internal.para: Scans through xbee->frame_handlers, matching the frame_type and frame_id (if frame_id is not zero). Passes the frame and context (from the frame handler table) to each matching handler.

parameterdescription.para: XBee device that received the frames.
Address of bytes in frame, starting with the frame type byte. Note that the frame is still in network byte order it is exactly as received from the XBee module.
Number of bytes in frame.

simplesect.para: Currently returns 0 in all cases. May be updated at some point with various error messages (e.g., no handlers are registered for the given frame type and ID) or the number of handlers it was dispatched to

parameterdescription.para: Invalid parameter
number of handlers frame was dispatched to

memberdef.argsstring: (xbee_dev_t *xbee, const void FAR *frame, uint16_t length, void FAR *context)
memberdef.name: xbee_frame_dump_modem_status

briefdescription.para: Frame handler for 0x8A (XBEE_FRAME_MODEM_STATUS) frames dumps modem status to STDOUT for debugging purposes.

detaileddescription.para: View the documentation of xbee_frame_handler_fn() for this function's parameters and return value.

briefdescription.para: Programs with the ZCL Identify Server Cluster can call this function in their main loop to have the XBee module's association LED flash fast (100ms cycle) when in Identify Mode.

parameterdescription.para: device to identify
TRUE if XBee should be in identify mode

briefdescription.para: Programs with the ZCL Identify Server Cluster can call this macro in their main loop to have the XBee module's association LED flash fast (100ms cycle) when in Identify Mode.

parameterdescription.para: device to identify

briefdescription.para: Maximum number of frames to dispatch per call to xbee_tick().
Max payload for all supported XBee types is 256 bytes.

detaileddescription.para: Actual firmware used may affect that size, and even enabling encryption can have an affect. Smart Energy and ZigBee are limited to 128 bytes, DigiMesh is 256 bytes.

briefdescription.para: Max Received Frame Size, including type, is for 0x91, Receive Explicit.
Max Transmitted Frame Size, including type, is for 0x11, Transmit Explicit.
Deprecated legacy macro, use XBEE_MAX_RX_FRAME_LEN instead.
Macro function to get a pointer to the LSB of the radio's firmware version.

detaileddescription.para: Typically used to define ZCL_STACK_VERSION_ADDR for the Basic cluster.

parameterdescription.para: name of xbee_dev_t to reference firmware_version from.

simplesect.para: address of the low byte of the firmware version, taking the processor's endian-ness into account

briefdescription.para: Add this macro to the list of XBee frame handlers to have modem status changes dumped to STDOUT.
This layer provides a frame-based interface to the XBee module.

detaileddescription.para: It uses a table of frame handlers to dispatch complete frames to higher layers of the API. If built with a dynamic
